disc:
An opioid overdose happens when the opioid pathway is excessively stimulated. Death can result in respiratory depression. 

After the ABCDE approach, naloxone is used to antagonize opioid receptors. Naloxone has no agnostic activity. The onset of action is within minutes. It can be administered IV, IM, subcutaneous, or through an endotracheal tube.

Two newly introduced agents are naltrexone and nalmefene.
